docs.text: sean connery stars as a harvard law professor who heads back into the courtroom , by way of the everglades , to defend a young , educated black man ( blair underwood ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the guy is on death row for the murder of a white girl , and says that his confession was coerced from the region's tough , black cop ( lawrence fishburne ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: watching connery and fishburne bump heads for two hours is amusing enough , but the plot's a joke .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's no logic at work here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tone is also an issue--there is none .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director arne glimcher never establishes exactly what his film is trying to say .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: is it a statement on human rights ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: is it a knock-off of silence of the lambs ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: glimcher never tells .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , he forces his characters to jump through hoop after hoop , over drawbridge after drawbridge , hoping that the audience won't notice what's missing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: just awful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the madness of king george 107 min .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: still wondering who nigel hawthorne is ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then check out his oscar- nominated work in the madness of king george , still playing in both raleigh and chapel hill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: stage director nicholas hytner , in a remarkable screen debut , has adapted alan bennett's 1991 tragic comedy to fine effect .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sumptuous-looking and only mildly stuffy , the film charts the madness that plagued king george iii ( hawthorne ) almost 30 years into his reign .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a man of no importance 98 min .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in suri krishnamma's a man of no importance , albert finney disappears so deeply into the role of a lovable dublin bus conductor that it's a shame when the film gets so serious around him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his character is a conductor with a passion for oscar wilde .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he reads to his riders , and once a year , with their help , he tries to stage one of the author's plays .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this year it's " salome . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for about an hour , there's a sweet magic behind finney and his troupe of working-class stiffs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: conflict arises , but it's small stuff--an administrator from the bus company here , an outraged catholic pork butcher ( michael gambon ) there .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but with finney at the wheel , so to speak , the film rolls smoothly over these plot points--just like the gorgeous leland double-decker bus in the story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where things get serious is toward the end of the film , when the plot takes a turn that the bus never would , and the story heads down a very dark alley that marks the end of an enjoyable ride .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the twist makes sense--and helps paint a complete picture of finney's character--but the trip to get there betrays the light , airy atmosphere of what had come before .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not a fatal misstep , mind you , and it doesn't send the story soaring into the realms of incredulity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's just a turn off .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the most fun that * i * had last month was in durham , at the carolina , at a mid-week screening of stanley kubrick's pitch-black comedy dr .

docs.text: strangelove ( or how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the 1964 film stars peter sellers ( in three roles ) , george c . scott , sterling hayden , and slim pickens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their antics brought the house down , which , to my surprise , was packed by an audience younger than the film .
